title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected. When creating a new 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string is entered in the 'default value' field, such as '55/66/9999', the invalid value is accepted and saved in the report design. This causes two problems. Firstly, the model should have stored a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss) to ensure portability. Secondly, the date value should have been validated by the UI or model.
OB: When a new 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string '55/66/9999' is entered in the 'default value' field, the invalid value is accepted and saved in the report design.
EB: The system should reject the invalid date string and display an error message indicating that the date format is invalid.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Save the report.
5. Verify that the system rejects the invalid date string and displays an error message indicating that the date format is invalid.
